title: Kinesiology
description: This course teaches principles related to the biomechanics, energetics and motor control of movement as it applies to human and animal movement, rehabilitation, and sports performance.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: (((BIOS 1107 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 1207 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and (BIOS 1107L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 1207L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)) or ((BIOS 1108 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 1208 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and (BIOS 1108L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 1208L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)) or BIOL 1510 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 1511 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 1520 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 1521 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 3751 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or APPH 3751 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 3753 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or APPH 3753 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 3753 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and (MATH 1113 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ACT Math 26 or SAT Mathematics 600 or MATH SECTION SCORE 620 or Converted ACT Math 600)
